reviews.review_msg: Despite what the other reviews say on here, Dr. Choy is a good professor, but can be a bit disorganized at times. Lectures were interesting and contained a lot of information. To do well for the exams, I would recommend typing everything that he says verbally and making your own notes from that. Overall, exams were fair and straightforward.

The course was my favourite of my undergrad degree. He's helpful and will take the time to explain things again if the class doesn't get it. Talking to people that have taken his class years before, I think he's improving with time as a professor.

Course is good, but exams are bad. Questions are vague and there are questions with only single word answer worth 3-5 marks. First midterm was out of 126. Doesnt matter if you have the right concepts in your answer, he looks for the specific words. Pay attention to the slides he concentrates on and memorize the important tables and molecules.

complete memorization based course. Expect to memorize and regurgitate entire tables as  half of his exam consists of tables straight off the slides. Study the notes and you will do decent. He looks for specific details on exams as well. Unless you are in love in immunology, try not to take this course.
